original_table_html:
Ultimate Social Status:
Extremely loyal consumers. High repeat-purchase rate. Much affiliation and attachment. Part of elite society.
Extremely High Quality:
The best watches in the world. Maximum quality, innovation, and design.		 Judgments Exclusive and Self-Rewarding:
Feelings of success and high social status. Social approval and self-respect.
True Luxury Product:
Hand-crafted timepieces made from premium materials. Perpetual self-winding technology. Official crown logo. Exceptional customer service. Holds value well.		 Performance Classic and Achievement Image:
Elite luxury image through sports and cultural ambassadors. Status symbol. Classic heritage.
Salience
High Awareness:
Most commonly recalled luxury watch in the world; more depth than breadth.
summary_markdown: This table outlines the components contributing to an "Ultimate Social Status" for a luxury watch brand, emphasizing extreme loyalty and attachment from consumers. This status is achieved through a combination of "Extremely High Quality" products, characterized by superior craftsmanship, innovation, design, and premium materials, and a "True Luxury Product" offering, featuring hand-crafted elements, advanced technology, and strong value retention. These product attributes drive "Performance" in terms of brand perception, cultivating an "Exclusive and Self-Rewarding" consumer experience marked by feelings of success, social approval, and self-respect. The brand also projects a "Classic and Achievement Image" through associations with sports and culture, reinforcing its status as a symbol of heritage and accomplishment. Crucially, this is supported by "Salience," specifically "High Awareness" as the most recalled luxury watch globally, demonstrating deep brand recognition.
